In-class Exercise 5

Author

Wong Zi Qi

1. Getting Started

pacman::p_load(tidyverse, readxl, SmartEDA, easystats, gtsummary, ggstatsplot)
car_resale <- read_xls("../data/ToyotaCorolla.xls", "data")

2. Data Overview

cols <- c("Mfg_Month", "HP_Bin", "CC_bin", "Doors", "Gears", "Cylinders",
          "Fuel_Type", "Color", "Met_Color", "Automatic", "Mfr_Guarantee",
          "BOVAG_Guarantee", "ABS", "Airbag_1", "Airbag_2", "Airco",
          "Automatic_airco", "Boardcomputer", "CD_Player", "Central_Lock",
          "Powered_Windows", "Power_Steering", "Radio", "Mistlamps", "Sport_Model",
          "Backseat_Divider", "Metallic_Rim", "Radio_cassette", "Tow_Bar")

car_resale <- read_xls("../data/ToyotaCorolla.xls", "data") %>%
  mutate(Id = as.character(Id)) %>%
  mutate(across(all_of(cols), as.factor))
car_resale %>% ExpNumStat(by = "A",
                          gp = NULL,
                          Qnt = seq(0,1,0.1),
                          MesofShape = 2,
                          Outlier = TRUE,
                          round = 2,
                          Nlim = 10)
          Vname Group   TN nNeg nZero nPos NegInf PosInf NA_Value

car_resale %>% ExpNumViz(target = NULL,
                         nlim = 10,
                         Page = c(2,2))
$`0`
car_resale %>% ExpNumViz(target = "Price",
                         nlim = 10,
                         Page = c(2,2))
$`0`

3. Bar plots for all categorical variables

car_resale%>% ExpCatViz(target = NULL,
                        col = "Sky blue",
                        clim = 10,
                        margin = 2,
                        Page = c(4,4),
                        sample = 16)
$`0`

4. Regression Model

attach(car_resale)
model <- lm(Price ~ Age_08_04 + Mfg_Year + KM + Weight + Guarantee_Period,
            data = car_resale)

model

Call:
lm(formula = Price ~ Age_08_04 + Mfg_Year + KM + Weight + Guarantee_Period, 
    data = car_resale)

Coefficients:
     (Intercept)         Age_08_04          Mfg_Year                KM  
      -2.637e+06        -1.409e+01         1.315e+03        -2.323e-02  
          Weight  Guarantee_Period  
       1.903e+01         2.770e+01  
check_collinearity(model)
# Check for Multicollinearity

Low Correlation

             Term  VIF     VIF 95% CI Increased SE Tolerance Tolerance 95% CI
               KM 1.46 [ 1.37,  1.57]         1.21      0.68     [0.64, 0.73]
           Weight 1.41 [ 1.32,  1.51]         1.19      0.71     [0.66, 0.76]
 Guarantee_Period 1.04 [ 1.01,  1.17]         1.02      0.97     [0.86, 0.99]

High Correlation

      Term   VIF     VIF 95% CI Increased SE Tolerance Tolerance 95% CI
 Age_08_04 31.07 [28.08, 34.38]         5.57      0.03     [0.03, 0.04]
  Mfg_Year 31.16 [28.16, 34.48]         5.58      0.03     [0.03, 0.04]
check_c <- check_collinearity(model)
plot(check_c)
model1 <- lm(Price ~ Age_08_04 + KM + Weight + Guarantee_Period, 
             data = car_resale)
check_model(model1)
tbl_regression(model1, intercept = TRUE) %>%
  add_glance_source_note(label = list(sigma ~ "U03C3"),
                         include = c(r.squared, adj.r.squared, AIC, statistic,
                                     p.value, sigma))
Characteristic Beta 95% CI1 p-value
(Intercept) -2,186 -4,093, -278 0.025
Age_08_04 -119 -125, -114 <0.001
KM -0.02 -0.03, -0.02 <0.001
Weight 20 18, 21 <0.001
Guarantee_Period 27 2.1, 52 0.034
RÂ² = 0.849; Adjusted RÂ² = 0.848; AIC = 24,915; Statistic = 2,005; p-value = <0.001; U03C3 = 1,413
1 CI = Confidence Interval 
p_model <- parameters(model1)
plot(parameters(model1))
ggcoefstats(model1, output = "plot")
